contentrichtext.text: '''John Penny''' (died 1520) was an [[England|English]] [[priest]], successively [[Bishop of Bangor]], 1504–1508, and [[Bishop of Carlisle]], 1508–1520. He was also Prior to [[Bradley Priory]] 1503–1508. His education is uncertain, though he may have been educated at [[Lincoln College, Oxford]], and later received his [[Doctor of Laws|LLD]] from the [[University of Cambridge]].<ref>T. Y. Cocks, [http://www.oxforddnb.com/view/article/21880 ‘Penny, John (d. 1520)’], ''Oxford Dictionary of National Biography'', Oxford University Press, 2004</ref><ref>{{Venn|id= PNY477J|name=Penny, John}}</ref> ==References== {{reflist}} {{s-start}} {{s-rel|ca}} {{succession box | title=[[Bishop of Bangor]] | before=[[Thomas Pigot (bishop)|Thomas Pigot]] | after=[[Thomas Skevington]] | years=1504–1508 }} {{succession box | title=[[Bishop of Carlisle]] | before=[[Roger Leyburn]] | after=[[John Kite]] | years=1508–1520 }} {{succession box | title= [[Abbot of Leicester]] | before= Gilbert Manchestre |after= Richard Pescall | years=1503–1508 }} {{s-end}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Penny, John | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = British bishop | DATE OF BIRTH = | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = 1520 | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Penny, John}} [[Category:1520 deaths]] [[Category:Alumni of Lincoln College, Oxford]] [[Category:Bishops of Bangor]] [[Category:Bishops of Carlisle]] [[Category:Tudor bishops]] [[Category:Year of birth unknown]] [[Category:15th-century births]] [[Category:15th-century English people]] [[Category:16th-century English people]] [[Category:Alumni of the University of Cambridge]] {{England-bio-stub}} {{UK-bishop-stub}}
